title: Apple's new iPad Pro has 4GB of RAM, according to Adobe
content: Adobe may have just spilled the beans on how much RAM the new iPad Pro sports. According to a news post published on the company's website, the new iPad from Apple will come with 4GB of RAM, doubling that what is available on the iPad Air 2. From Adobe: "During Apple's keynote, we also demonstrated the extraordinary speed and precision of Adobe's Creative Cloud mobile apps on Apple's new iPad Pro. iPad Pro is great for creative workflows with a high res 12.9-inch touch screen display at 2732 x 2048 pixels, A9X chip, and 4GB RAM." Thanks, Adobe! We'll have to wait for actual tests or a tear down to confirm the amount of RAM inside the iPad Pro, but 4GB is looking more likely. Here's what you need to know about Apple's new tablets Source: Adobe, via: ZDNet
source: iMore - The #1 site for iPhone, iPad, Mac, and all things Apple!
